Crocus sativus L ( C. sativus), commonly known as saffron belongs to the Iridaceas family, Crocoideae superfamily which is cultivated in many countries including Iran, Afghanistan, Turkey and Spain.
15 Saffron consists dried and dark-red stigma with a small portion of the yellowish style attached of C. sativus. It used mainly as herbal medicine in various regions in the world.
